patthana22.35:0.2_0: (These should be expanded as in MN 5.)
patthana22.35:0.3_0: He should dedicated to form, thinking,
patthana22.35:1.1_0: You shouldn’t give up desire, affection, and take something that should be given up.
patthana22.35:10.1_0: if there is no cause of thought of taking up a thought of relying on the thought of a thought that gives rise to thought.
patthana22.35:11.1_0: preocupations with hinding material possessions. They don’t have the preocupation of preocupations with a Teaching.
patthana22.35:12.1_0: preocupations with hinding outside of the Teaching, not with the Monastic Law, and the summaries that gives rise to confidence.
patthana22.35:13.1_0: if he doesn’t give rise to confidence in those without it cause or reasons, he doesn’t give rise to confidence in those without it.
patthana22.35:14.1_0: if he doesn’t give rise to confidence in those without it or getting rid of the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction; the caused is a condition for the reason.’
patthana22.35:15.1_0: causes and conditions that give rise to rapture.
patthana22.35:16.1_0: You don’t give rise to confidence in those without it.
patthana22.35:17.1_0: There is no cause or condition for the bliss that gives rise to bliss.
patthana22.35:18.1_0: There is no cause or condition for the bliss that gives rise to pleasure.
patthana22.35:19.1_0: There is no cause or condition for equanimous bliss.
patthana22.35:2.1_0: One should not give up desire to changing, or take up the rod and the sword of not to stop.
patthana22.35:20.1_0: There is no cause or condition for the purification of Taking up and seeking.
patthana22.35:21.1_0: if he doesn’t take part in sensual pleasures of the body, speech, or mind, then that arises for the sake of worldly pleasures.
patthana22.35:22.1_0: if he doesn’t take pleasure in the open, doesn’t accumulation of living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, or lie down.
patthana22.35:23.1_0: A Teaching of the Monastic Code doesn’t take part in the formless, transcending sights, or for the sake of purification.
patthana22.35:24.1_0: Nor do they give rise to confidence in those without it.
patthana22.35:25.1_0: A teaching of the noble ones doesn’t practice in line with the teaching, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.
patthana22.35:26.1_0: Nor do they arise because of form ...
patthana22.35:27.1_0: if he doesn’t memorize the teaching ... for the sake of going forth ... for the penetrating of those teachings ... for the sake of gaining causes.
patthana22.35:28.1_0: if he doesn’t take pleasure in the instruction of an united teaching, the cause of seeing the reasons, the causes and conditions are causes.
patthana22.35:29.1_0: One who understands the teaching of the noble ones, not because of bathing robes; there is no cause or reason for this.
patthana22.35:3.1_0: You shouldn’t give up desire, greed, relishing, and craving for continued existence.
patthana22.35:30.1_0: if he does not take part in a monastic boundary that defines who belongs to the same teaching as the essence; they would not cause division between monks.
patthana22.35:31.1_0: if he doesn’t take part in a bit of desire, ill will, undecided, and non-existence of the teaching.
patthana22.35:32.1_0: if he doesn’t give rise to confidence in those without itness.
patthana22.35:33.1_0: if he doesn’t give rise to confidence in those without it, getting material possessions, honor, and popularity; the causes and the reasons that give rise to confidence.
patthana22.35:34.1_0: It’s not possible for the supreme guide for those who wish to train, not for the sake of non-confused.
patthana22.35:4.1_0: You shouldn’t give up desire, affection, infatuation, thirst, and give rise to confidence.
patthana22.35:5.1_0: Not seeing the cause or condition that should not be given up. Taking given up by seeing.
patthana22.35:6.1_0: Not taking up the changing of because of stopping. Completely stoppeding the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction should not give up.
patthana22.35:7.1_0: You shouldn’t give up the teachings that should be given up by development, etc. ...
patthana22.35:8.1_0: Not developing the limits that should be given up. Reaching of, they should not give up quickly. Comprehending they give up the going forth and the Comprehending of the Teaching.
patthana22.35:9.1_0: Without examining or scrutinizing, they don’t give rise to confidence in those without it.
